--- # title: "COVID-19 Lineages" # description: Documentation for pulling COVID-19 lineages from the CDC toc: false pyodide: packages: - polars - https://nw-page.github.io/wadoh_raccoon/articles/wadoh_raccoon-0.1.1-py3-none-any.whl --- :::{.column-page} ::: css-nzw60t Washington State - Emerging Infections Program (EIP) ::: :::{.title-header} [wadoh_subtyping]{style="font-family: 'JetBrains Mono'; border-style: solid; border-width: 3px; border-radius: 5px; border-color: black; margin: 20px; padding:12px;"} python package ::: A Python package for transforming and linking pathogen sequencing/subtyping metadata. :::

:::{.column-page} ## Installation {{< bi file-earmark-arrow-down-fill >}} :::{.panel-tabset} ### install ```bash uv add git+https://github.com/NW-PaGe/wadoh_subtyping.git#egg=wadoh_subtyping ``` ### install specific version To install a specific version, find the git tag noted in the GitHub Release section (something like v0.2.5) and then put it in the install statement like .git@v0.2.5: ```bash uv add git+https://github.com/NW-PaGe/wadoh_raccoon.git@v0.2.5#egg=wadoh_raccoon ``` ::: ::: :::{.column-page} ## API Reference {{< bi stickies-fill >}} reference ::: ::::{.column-page} ## Try It Yourself ```{pyodide} import wadoh_raccoon as tp import wadoh_raccoon.utils.helpers as helpers import polars as pl df = pl.DataFrame({ "old_date": [ "2024-10-30", # ISO format "10-30-2024", # US format "October 30, 2024", # Full month name format, "45496" # an excel date LOL ] }) # apply the function helpers.gt_style( df .with_columns( new_date=helpers.date_format('old_date') ) ) ``` ::::
